functions.description: Wraps the existing error in a `WithContext` variant, prepending a contextual message for better diagnostics.
examples: let err = AuditError::config("missing key").context("while parsing config.toml");
functions.name: AuditError::context

parameters.description: Human-readable context string to associate with the error
parameters.name: context

functions.returns: A new `AuditError::WithContext` instance containing the context and boxed original error.
functions.signature: pub fn context(self, context: impl Into<String>) -> Self

functions.description: Creates a `Config` variant error for configuration-related issues.
examples: let err = AuditError::config("Invalid format in settings.yaml");
functions.name: AuditError::config

parameters.description: Descriptive message for the configuration error
parameters.name: msg

functions.signature: pub fn config(msg: impl Into<String>) -> Self

functions.description: Creates an `LlmApi` variant error for issues with LLM API interactions.
functions.name: AuditError::llm_api

parameters.description: Details about the LLM API failure
parameters.name: msg

functions.signature: pub fn llm_api(msg: impl Into<String>) -> Self

functions.description: Creates a generic `Other` variant for uncategorized errors.
functions.name: AuditError::other
functions.signature: pub fn other(msg: impl Into<String>) -> Self

functions.description: Extends `Result<T, AuditError>` to add context to errors non-destructively; returns unchanged `Ok` values.
functions.name: ResultExt::context

parameters.description: The result potentially containing an error
parameters.name: self

parameters.description: Context string to apply if an error is present
parameters.name: context

functions.signature: fn context(self, context: impl Into<String>) -> Result<T>

result.summary: This module defines the `AuditError` enum and `Result<T>` type alias for comprehensive error handling in the audit service. It covers errors from Git, I/O, HTTP, JSON, configuration, LLM API, file paths, repositories, parsing, rate limits, and more, using `thiserror` for automatic `Display` and `From` impls. Utility methods and the `ResultExt` trait enable easy error creation and contextual wrapping.
